title: 110_s2486
content: HIV Nondiscrimination in Travel and Immigration Act of 2007 - Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to eliminate the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) bar to US admission. Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to: (1) convene a panel of public health experts to review immigration policies regarding HIV as a communicable disease of public health significance. And (2) make a determination and report to Congress regarding the continued listing of HIV as a health-related ground for inadmissibility.
